name: Theft
description: Incidents involving the unauthorized taking of property without the use of force.

name: Robbery
description: Crimes where property is taken by force or intimidation from a person or place.

name: Assault
description: Physical attacks or violent confrontations that result in harm or the threat of harm.

name: Homicide
description: Cases involving the unlawful killing of an individual, including murder and attempted murder.

name: Fraud
description: Incidents of deception or financial scams intended to gain property or money illicitly.

name: Vehicle Collision
description: Incidents where two or more vehicles collide, often resulting in property damage or injuries.

name: Pedestrian Involvement
description: Accidents that include pedestrians being struck or endangered by vehicles.

name: Hit-and-Run
description: Accidents in which the driver responsible leaves the scene without providing assistance or identification.

name: Multi-Vehicle Pileup
description: Large-scale collisions involving several vehicles, typically resulting in complex traffic disruptions.

name: Cardiac Arrest
description: Situations where an individual's heart stops functioning effectively, requiring immediate intervention.

name: Stroke
description: Emergencies where blood flow to the brain is interrupted, leading to potential brain damage.

name: Trauma/Injury
description: Accidents or incidents resulting in physical injuries or significant bodily harm.

name: Overdose/Poisoning
description: Cases involving excessive intake of substances or exposure to toxic materials.

name: Other Medical Emergency
description: Any urgent medical situation that does not fall under the above categories.

name: Building Fire
description: Fires occurring in homes or residential buildings, posing immediate danger to inhabitants.

name: Wildfire
description: Large, uncontrolled fires that spread across forests, grasslands, or rural areas.

name: Vehicle Fire
description: Fires involving cars or other types of vehicles, often requiring specialized response.

name: Other Fire Incident
description: Fire-related incidents that do not fit into the standard categories listed above.

name: Graffiti
description: Unauthorized painting, tagging, or markings on public or private property.

name: Vehicle Vandalism
description: Acts of vandalism specifically targeting vehicles, such as keying or breaking windows.

name: Public Property Damage
description: Damage to public assets like parks, monuments, or street furniture.

name: Suspicious Person
description: Observations of individuals exhibiting unusual or concerning behavior that may warrant further attention.

name: Suspicious Vehicle
description: Vehicles acting in an odd or unexplained manner, which could indicate potential criminal activity.

name: Unusual Behavior
description: Any behavior that deviates from the norm and raises concerns for safety or security.

name: Other Suspicious Activity
description: Any other behavior or situation that appears out of place and may require further investigation.

name: Road Damage/Potholes
description: Damage to road surfaces, such as potholes or cracks, that may affect driving safety.

name: Streetlight/Traffic Signal Failure
description: Malfunctions or outages in public lighting or traffic control systems.

name: Sidewalk/Pathway Damage
description: Deterioration or hazards on pedestrian pathways and sidewalks.

name: Public Utility Issues
description: Problems affecting essential public services like water, electricity, or gas supply.

name: Structural Damage
description: Damage to critical infrastructure, such as bridges, public buildings, or monuments.

name: Heavy Rain/Flooding
description: Incidents of intense rainfall that result in flooding or water accumulation on streets.

name: Snow Storm
description: Severe winter weather conditions characterized by heavy snowfall and reduced visibility.

name: Icy Road Conditions
description: Hazardous conditions on roadways due to ice formation, increasing the risk of accidents.

name: High Winds/Tornado
description: Events involving extremely strong winds or tornado formation that can cause significant damage.

name: Extreme Heat
description: Periods of unusually high temperatures that may pose health risks and strain resources.

name: Hail/Severe Storm
description: Storms that produce large hail or other severe weather phenomena leading to property damage or hazards.

name: Festival/Fair
description: Organized community celebrations, festivals, or fairs that bring people together.

name: Public Gathering/Rally
description: Large-scale meetings, rallies, or protests that involve community participation.

name: Concert/Performance
description: Public musical or performance events, either outdoor or in community venues.

name: Community Meeting/Block Party
description: Neighborhood gatherings or block parties designed to foster community interaction.

name: Sporting Event
description: Organized sports matches or community athletic events that engage local residents.

name: Moose
description: Sightings of moose, a common and sometimes unpredictable species in Canada.

name: Cougar
description: Observations of cougars, which may pose a risk in certain areas.

name: Bear
description: Reports of bear sightings, including grizzlies and black bears.

name: Wolf
description: Encounters with wolves, common in some regions of Canada.

name: Coyotes
description: Sightings of coyotes, which are prevalent in urban and rural settings.

name: Bigfoot
description: Unverified sightings that could be attributed to local folklore.

name: Good Samaritan Acts
description: Reports of individuals who step in to help others during emergencies or crises without expecting anything in return.

name: Community Service
description: Instances of organized or spontaneous volunteer efforts that benefit the community at large.

name: Environmental Stewardship
description: Actions aimed at protecting or enhancing the local environment, such as community cleanups or tree plantings.

name: Neighborly Assistance
description: Examples of neighbors or community members helping each other with everyday tasks or in times of need.

name: Random Acts of Kindness
description: Spontaneous and unexpected gestures that spread positivity and support throughout the community.

name: Dog
description: Lost or found dog. Please provide breed, color, and distinctive features.

name: Cat
description: Lost or found cat. Please provide details such as color, size, and any identifying marks.

name: Bird
description: Lost or found bird. Include species if known and description of plumage.

name: Reptile
description: Lost or found reptile. Include details about the species and any unique markings.

name: Other
description: Lost or found pet that does not fit into the above categories. Please provide additional details.
